title: Liverpool ace Rhian Brewster on how he knew Jurgen Klopp had huge faith in him
text:

Rhian Brewster revealed the faith Jurgen Klopp has in him as he vowed to challenge Sadio Mane, Mo Salah and Roberto Firmino for a place in Liverpool's attack.

The 19-year-old and was on the bench for the Reds' Champions League final triumph over Tottenham in June, and is highly rated by Klopp.

So much so, in fact, that Brewster said the manager refused flat out to send the teenager on loan to earn first-team game time this season.

While other young Liverpool talents such as Harry Wilson and Ben Woodburn have gone on loan to Bournemouth and Oxford United respectively, England under-21 international Brewster has stayed to fight for his opportunity in Klopp's table-topping team.

And the striker is prepared to be patient and is confident that Klopp has "a plan" for him.

(Image: David Rawcliffe/Propaganda)

“You’ve just got to be patient and wait for your turn,” Brewster told Sky Sports. “Obviously the boss has a plan for me and he knows what he’s doing, clearly.

“Just chatting to him and stuff, he says, ‘Just be patient, your time will come, it will happen,’ and I’m just waiting. I’m being patient.

“He said no (to a loan) straight away, so that shows that he has great faith in me and wants to push me towards the first team.

(Image: Andrew Powell)

“Obviously it’s hard, with our front three, to get game-time because they’re all amazing players. It’s going to be difficult, but you just have to keep going and going.”

Brewster, who can play as a striker or second striker, has played five games for Liverpool Under-23s in Premier League 2 this season, scoring twice.

Cup games appear to be the most likely route into the first team for Brewster for now - although Liverpool face a stern test in the fourth round of the EFL Cup when Arsenal visit on October 30.
description: Teenage striker is not fazed by 'difficult' task of trying to earn starting place with Mane, Salah and Firmino ahead of him
